item.title: No title
Experience Rating Analysis - ModMaster | Zywave
item.description:
Experience Rating Analysis - ModMaster | Zywave

A ModMaster, in my opinion, should be completed every year you receive your workers’ compensation experience mod from the WCRB or NCCI - Immediately. Wisconsin is actually one of the few states that allows your mod to be refiled in the event you find errors (inaccurate payrolls, class codes, and over-reserved claims). The ModMaster serves many purposes, but it’s a tool that allows you to catch mistakes if you use it appropriately. If you have not seen or heard of a ModMaster before, please contact tom.boudreau@associatedbrc.com

item.title: No title
Risk management for manufacturers: Protect your property, income and other crucial assets
item.description:
Risk management for manufacturers: Protect your property, income and other crucial assets

In this publication, we will first discuss the best practices for protecting your manufacturing plant and contents. Next, we will address the importance of protecting your income stream and paying for the extra expenses that accompany a property loss. Finally, we will address some of the less obvious property exposures that can damage your business.

item.title: How to Mitigate the Threat of Ransomware
item.description:
How to Mitigate the Threat of Ransomware

Unfortunately, ransomware attacks on corporate systems are becoming more common. Here's how to manage the risk. All too often, companies' focus after being victimized by a ransomware attack is on the ransom paid, which is generally the most trivial outcome of the incident.

item.title: Transgender employees in the workplace: Bathrooms, bullying and other concerns
item.description:
Transgender employees in the workplace: Bathrooms, bullying and other concerns

You are an employer of choice. You pride yourself on having a diversified workplace, where everyone is respectful and inclusive to one another. And then Stan comes to you. He tells you that he’s always struggled with his gender and he’s finally taking measures to do something about it.

item.title: 10 insurance considerations for emerging businesses
item.description:
10 insurance considerations for emerging businesses

Some of the world’s greatest corporations were started in the founder’s basement or garage. When Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs created Apple, they were not thinking about insurance. They were worried about creating their product, getting it manufactured and getting sales. Everything else was secondary. So how should entrepreneurs approach property/casualty insurance?

item.title: Companies Bringing Manufacturing Jobs Back to US
item.description:
Companies Bringing Manufacturing Jobs Back to US

From Jan, 2010 until July 2016 the Reshoring Initiative estimates that 265,000 jobs have come back to the United States from abroad.

item.title: If a data breach happened, how would your company pay for damages?
item.description:
If a data breach happened, how would your company pay for damages?

Despite frequent reports of hacking, cybercrime, security breaches and related events in all parts of the U.S., many middle market companies continue to underestimate their exposure to these attacks along with their need for focused risk management measures, which may include the purchase of specialized insurance.

item.title: Smart Manufacturing / Rockwell
item.description:
Smart Manufacturing / Rockwell

The global push for smart manufacturing is underway for good reason - it offers nearly unlimited opportunities to improve operations, create new value and respond to challenges, such as the skilled-labor shortage. While some manufacturers have fully embraced smart manufacturing and are already reaping the benefits, most still have much work ahead of them.
